column4: i can't manage to get remote desktop to work here through router, can anybody help? i have set up port forwarding, but it says "connection to host X was lost"
what are you trying to remote?
i'm trying to set up remote desktop sharing to be able to provide tech support to a user here
what os are you trying to remote?
i try to use the ubuntu remote desktop sharing
try terminal services
can you please explain?
application > internet >terminal server client
thanks :-) , i'm trying to learn about this now
did you have better luck?
not yet, trying to understand it, i haven't used it before, only the remote desktop
well... i tried using the remote desktop to see my xp machine, but with no luck... in terminal server however... lots of luck, just thought you may have to use the same thing.
thx, but  i'm still trying to understand how to use it.
terminal this:  man tsclient
to quit press 'q'
when both os are ubuntu, is it still useful to use this?
not sure..

Terminal Server Client (tsclient) lets you connect to remote desktops using many different protocols. It has support for specific connection options including color depth, screen size, and motion blocking.
thx, i'll give it a try
for some reason the VNC protocol is disabled and can't be selected...
sudo apt-get install xtightvncviewer
then try vnc in terminal service client
